Detailed Description

Programmer can send short message by this class.

A Short Message Service message.

Manages SMS operations such as sending text, and pdu SMS messages. Get this object by calling the static method SmsManager.getDefault().

 // Get SmsManager Instance by getDefault()
 SmsManager smsManager = gaia::telephony::SmsManager::getDefault();
 // Send Message by function, sendTestMessage.
 smsManager.sendTextMessage("+886912345678", "+886931000099", "Hi Gaia");

 // After receiving PDU from SmsMessge, you can use related function to get short message info.
 SmsMessage smsMessage = gaia::telephony::SmsMessage::createFromDemand(demand);
 // and then, you can retrieve the message body
 smsMesssage.getMessageBody();

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::telephony::SmsManager::ResultError

SMS send failure result codes.

Enumerator:
RESULT_ERROR_GENERIC_FAILURE 

Generic failure cause.

RESULT_ERROR_RADIO_OFF 

Failed because radio was explicitly turned off.

RESULT_ERROR_NULL_PDU 

Failed because no pdu provided.

RESULT_ERROR_NO_SERVICE 

Failed because service is currently unavailable.

RESULT_ERROR_LIMIT_EXCEEDED 

Failed because we reached the sending queue limit.

{}

RESULT_ERROR_FDN_CHECK_FAILURE 

Failed because FDN is enabled.

{}

Definition at line 71 of file SmsManager.h.

enum gaia::telephony::SmsManager::StatusOnIcc

see SmsMessage.getStatusOnIcc

Enumerator:
STATUS_ON_ICC_FREE 

Free space (TS 51.011 10.5.3 / 3GPP2 C.S0023 3.4.27).

STATUS_ON_ICC_READ 

Received and read (TS 51.011 10.5.3 / 3GPP2 C.S0023 3.4.27).

STATUS_ON_ICC_UNREAD 

Received and unread (TS 51.011 10.5.3 / 3GPP2 C.S0023 3.4.27).

STATUS_ON_ICC_SENT 

Stored and sent (TS 51.011 10.5.3 / 3GPP2 C.S0023 3.4.27).

STATUS_ON_ICC_UNSENT 

Stored and unsent (TS 51.011 10.5.3 / 3GPP2 C.S0023 3.4.27).

void gaia::telephony::SmsManager::sendDataMessage ( const gaia::base::String &  destinationAddress,
const gaia::base::String &  scAddress,
int16_t  destinationPort,
const gaia::base::ByteArray &  data,
const gaia::core::PendingDemand &  sentIntent,
const gaia::core::PendingDemand &  deliveryIntent 
) const

Send a data based SMS to a specific application port.

Parameters:
destinationAddressthe address to send the message to
scAddressis the service center address or null to use the current default SMSC
destinationPortthe port to deliver the message to
datathe body of the message to send
sentIntentif not NULL this PendingIntent is broadcast when the message is sucessfully sent, or failed. The result code will be Activity.RESULT_OK<code> for success, or one of these errors:
RESULT_ERROR_GENERIC_FAILURE
RESULT_ERROR_RADIO_OFF
RESULT_ERROR_NULL_PDU
For RESULT_ERROR_GENERIC_FAILURE the sentIntent may include the extra "errorCode" containing a radio technology specific value, generally only useful for troubleshooting.
The per-application based SMS control checks sentIntent. If sentIntent is NULL the caller will be checked against all unknown applicaitons, which cause smaller number of SMS to be sent in checking period.
deliveryIntentif not NULL this PendingIntent is broadcast when the message is delivered to the recipient. The raw pdu of the status report is in the extended data ("pdu").
Exceptions:
IllegalArgumentExceptionif destinationAddress or data are empty
void gaia::telephony::SmsManager::sendMultipartTextMessage ( const gaia::base::String &  destinationAddress,
const gaia::base::String &  scAddress,
const gaia::base::StringArray &  parts,
const gaia::base::Vector< gaia::core::PendingDemand > &  sentIntents,
const gaia::base::Vector< gaia::core::PendingDemand > &  deliveryIntents 
) const

Send a multi-part text based SMS.

The callee should have already divided the message into correctly sized parts by calling divideMessage.

Parameters:
destinationAddressthe address to send the message to
scAddressis the service center address or null to use the current default SMSC
partsan ArrayList of strings that, in order, comprise the original message
sentIntentsif not null, an ArrayList of PendingIntents (one for each message part) that is broadcast when the corresponding message part has been sent. The result code will be Activity.RESULT_OK<code> for success, or one of these errors:
RESULT_ERROR_GENERIC_FAILURE
RESULT_ERROR_RADIO_OFF
RESULT_ERROR_NULL_PDU
For RESULT_ERROR_GENERIC_FAILURE each sentIntent may include the extra "errorCode" containing a radio technology specific value, generally only useful for troubleshooting.
The per-application based SMS control checks sentIntent. If sentIntent is NULL the caller will be checked against all unknown applicaitons, which cause smaller number of SMS to be sent in checking period.
deliveryIntentsif not null, an ArrayList of PendingIntents (one for each message part) that is broadcast when the corresponding message part has been delivered to the recipient. The raw pdu of the status report is in the extended data ("pdu").
Exceptions:
IllegalArgumentExceptionif destinationAddress or data are empty
void gaia::telephony::SmsManager::sendTextMessage ( const gaia::base::String &  destinationAddress,
const gaia::base::String &  scAddress,
const gaia::base::String &  text,

RESULT_ERROR_GENERIC_FAILURE
RESULT_ERROR_RADIO_OFF
RESULT_ERROR_NULL_PDU
For RESULT_ERROR_GENERIC_FAILURE the sentIntent may include the extra "errorCode" containing a radio technology specific value, generally only useful for troubleshooting.
The per-application based SMS control checks sentIntent. If sentIntent is NULL the caller will be checked against all unknown applications, which cause smaller number of SMS to be sent in checking period.
deliveryIntentif not NULL this PendingIntent is broadcast when the message is delivered to the recipient. The raw pdu of the status report is in the extended data ("pdu").
Exceptions:
IllegalArgumentExceptionif destinationAddress or text are empty
